content: Let's take a deep breath and tell us about what your conversation with the anonymous Satoshi Nakamoto if you received a private invitation to spend the weekend with him! Remember it's a private meeting we just want to know what you'd like to tell him about his invention and related discussion.Everyone gather together and view replies I'm sure many of us have modification and a lot to tell him since we've learned quite a lot from This can bring insight to many of us too I'm very sure.@user soloninja it's a question asked. I actually didn't meet with him. I hope you understand now.Thanks for all your replies so far they're thrilling actually.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: I'm pretty sure you are talking about having a conversation with an AI Satoshi Nakamoto, because there's no chance in hell he is resurfacing into public view. Either he's dead, or he's ran far, far away.But most people wouldn't care about doing that, because then it would not be the real thing.<also Satoshi would probably get lots of notifications from scammers and other low-lives, just like the rest of us get around here.>

comments.author: DYING_S0UL
comments.body: Quote from: Good_Doctor on August 07, 2023, 11:00:24 PMLet's take a deep breath and tell us about what your conversation with the anonymous Satoshi Nakamoto if you received a private invitation to spend the weekend with him! Remember it's a private meeting we just want to know what you'd like to tell him about his invention and related discussion.Everyone gather together and view replies I'm sure many of us have modification and a lot to tell him since we've learned quite a lot from This can bring insight to many of us too I'm very sure.It would be in your dream. I don't think he would ever reveal his true identity. Not in this lifetime. And it isn't advisable either. He isn't some random guy, who can come up a stage and say 'hey I'm Satoshi, the creator of Bitcoin". Not a chance buddy. Even if he were in this community, if he wanted to he could have but all these years his identity is still a mystery. This community even has a reserved badge for him, I think it was a platinum badge. But sadly nobody ever claimed that. Check this out: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2834773.0

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: If it will really happen then there's only one question I am going to ask to satoshi nakamoto, what are your next plan after creating Bitcoin?. Well, if you answer me that then I would be glad to know what are the plans that Satoshi Nakamoto in the future. I know that it won't be possible since we know it's been years and no one still know who he is. OP, if you were Satoshi Nakamoto then what will be your answer for my question?.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Satoshi’s intent with Bitcoin is pretty clear, so on the top of my head, I’ll probably ask him his thoughts on smart contract platforms like Ethereum and Solana. Bitcoin maximalists are very against these(there are both valid and crappy takes), so I’d like to hear what the man himself has to say.

comments.author: Good_Doctor
comments.body: Quote from: nakamura12 on August 08, 2023, 08:29:13 AMOP, if you were Satoshi Nakamoto then what will be your answer for my question?.My reply will simply be "The sea is big enough for many animals I've been able to awaken the sleeping giants with my invention in so many around the world and I've laid the foundation for a decentralized future. My goal is to see Bitcoin embraced as a global currency, free from centralized control. I envision continued innovation to enhance scalability, security, and adoption. Let's work together to empower individuals, promote financial inclusion, and revolutionize how we perceive and use money.I am not perfect in my creation but it will go a long way yet I'm hoping to come up with better currency while I maintain anonymity or my invention will provide aid for someone else to do so...you already have some others trying to hold grounds with Bitcoin and it's cool"

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: I've often had taughts about this too. imagining what it would be like to meet Satoshi Nakamoto in person. the likelihood of such an encounter seems impossible. But If I were given the opportunity, I would be eager to engage in a conversation with the creator of Bitcoin. I'd begin by inquiring#is Satoshi a person or a group of people?#what was the main reason around Satoshi's decision to remain anonymous. I'm well aware that this choice was made to preserve the focus on the technology rather than the individual, but I'm curious to know if this anonymity has brought about any unexpected challenges or opportunities. #Then I will also want to know about how many Bitcoin he's worth, since his the creator of the technology, most people would assume he would be the richest of all Bitcoiners.

comments.body: If I had a chance to spend a weekend with Satoshi Nakamota. first of all I will say "You you arre like batman, you keep your identity under the name of Satoshi and hidden so long after doing such a uncountable duty to world economy. did you know the coin you introduce bitcoin, it is the digital gold in the world... I had never except Satoshi is you. I am glad to know. keep your face under Satoshi. " I will eat a chocolate with him and will say good bye to him.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Well the first thing I am going to ask him is why did he disappear. He just left many people who can pretend they are him, take his credit for his work he did. Maybe he is a nice man and does not want to have people thank him for making Bitcoin what it is now.Then I am going to ask him how he feels about Ethereum. And if he would ever do something with Vitalik Buterin. They both have brilliant minds.
